sn12.52:4.2: “There are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, your craving grows.
sn12.52:4.3: Craving is a condition for grasping.
sn12.52:4.4: Grasping is a condition for future existence.
sn12.52:4.5: Grasping is a condition for future existence.
sn12.52:4.6: Rebirth is a condition that gives rise to old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.52:4.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.52:5.1: Suppose a bonfire was burning with ten, twenty, thirty, or forty loads of wood.
sn12.52:5.2: And from time to time someone would toss in dry grass, cow dung, or wood.
sn12.52:5.3: Fueled and sustained by that, the bonfire would burn for a long time.
sn12.52:5.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the gratification provided by these things, your craving grows.
sn12.52:5.5: Craving is a condition for grasping. …
sn12.52:5.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.52:6.1: There are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, your craving ceases.
sn12.52:6.3: When grasping ceases, future existence ceases.
sn12.52:6.4: When future existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn12.52:6.5: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn12.52:6.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.52:7.1: Suppose a bonfire was burning with ten, twenty, thirty, or forty loads of wood.
sn12.52:7.2: And from time to time someone would toss in dry grass, cow dung, or wood.
sn12.52:7.3: As the original fuel is used up and no more is added, the bonfire would be extinguished due to lack of fuel.
sn12.52:7.4: In the same way, there are things that are prone to being grasped. When you concentrate on the drawbacks of these things, your craving ceases. When craving ceases, grasping ceases. …
sn12.52:7.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
